pr_title: Test for removed dynamic filters explicitly

timeline.bodyText:
i prefer the previous formatting
i know it does not conform to our global formatting rules, but i find this way more readable in plan tests
timeline.author: findepi
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -116,7 +116,8 @@ public void testUnconsumedDynamicFilterInJoin()
                 join(
                         INNER,
                         ImmutableList.of(equiJoinClause("ORDERS_OK", "LINEITEM_OK")),
-                        filter("ORDERS_OK > 0",

timeline.bodyText:
This is good. But it seems too easy to use a filter overload which does not check for dynamic filters.
ideas

this class could define filter method that delegates to PlanMatchPattern#filter making sure the lax matching is not used in this class
the PlanMatchPattern#filter  lax overload could be renamed to eg staticFilter, making it easier and more tempting to use the more strict overload
timeline.author: findepi
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -181,7 +182,8 @@ public void testUnmatchedDynamicFilter()
                                 ImmutableList.of(equiJoinClause("ORDERS_OK", "LINEITEM_OK")),
                                 tableScan("orders", ImmutableMap.of("ORDERS_OK", "orderkey")),
                                 filter(
-                                        "LINEITEM_OK > 0",
+                                        expression("LINEITEM_OK > 0"),
+                                        TRUE_LITERAL,

replies.bodyText:
this class could define filter method that delegates to PlanMatchPattern#filter making sure the lax matching is not used in this class

that makes sense
replies.author: sopel39

timeline.message: Test for removed dynamic filters explicitly
